poem:
**Age of Rage**

In the tinderbox of voices  
where shouting matches smother whispers,  
bridges decay in moments;  
truths like moths forget their glow  
and flit unseen into darkness.  
Reach across silence –  
extend your palm of patience.  
See if a handshake, still warm,  
survives where words have barely marched,  
and kindles more than embers of discourse.
